meanings.definition: A small, salty fish often used in cooking.
meanings.sent1: I added anchovies to the pasta sauce for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: The pizza had anchovies on top, which added a salty taste.
meanings.sent3: Why did the anchovies refuse to play cards? Because they were afraid of being dealt!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a tin of anchovies, unexpected and full of flavor.
meanings.sent5: The anchovies in the salad danced on my taste buds like salty little acrobats.

meanings.definition: A type of fish commonly found in the Mediterranean Sea.
meanings.sent1: The anchovies swam gracefully in the clear waters of the Mediterranean Sea.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen often catch anchovies in the Mediterranean for their rich taste.
meanings.sent3: Why did the anchovies throw a party? To celebrate their sea-crets!
meanings.sent4: The school of anchovies moved in unison, shimmering like a silver wave.
meanings.sent5: The anchovies darted through the water like tiny silver arrows, swift and agile.
